IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: THE MARY FREE BED MEDICAL GROUP WAS FORMED TO SUPPORT CHARITABLE HEALTHCARE, RESEARCH, AND EDUCATION.
IRS990.Desc: DELIVER HEALTH CARE AND HEALTH CARE RELATED SERVICES TO PATIENTS REQUIRING SUCH CARE AND WILL SUPPORT THE CHARITABLE HEALTH CARE MISSION OF THE MARY FREE BED REHABILITATION HOSPITAL REGARDLESS OF ABILITY TO PAY. THERE WERE 82,071 PHYSICIAN RVU'S (RELATIVE VALUE UNITS) FOR THE FISCAL YEAR.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATIONS EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR, MICHAEL JAKUBOWSKI, IS COMPENSATED BY A RELATED PARTY WHO USES A COMPENSATION COMMITTEE, FORM 990 OF OTHER ORGANIZATIONS, COMPENSATION SURVEY OR STUDY, AND APPROVAL BY THE COMPENSATION COMMITTEE TO DETERMINE HIS COMPENSATION.
PERSON(S) INVOLVED: MICHAEL JAKUBOWSKI, MD, BRUCE BRASSER, AND RANDALL DENEFF

EXPLANATION OF INVOLVEMENT: MICHAEL JAKUBOWSKI, MD IS A TRUSTEE OF MARY FREE BED REHABILITATION HOSPITAL.MICHAEL JAKUBOWSKI, MD, BRUCE BRASSER, AND RANDALL DENEFF ARE EMPLOYEES OF MARY FREE BED REHABILITATION HOSPITAL.
THE ORGANIZATION CEASED ALL ACTIVITIES DURING THE YEAR - SEE SCHEDULE N.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 6
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION'S SOLE MEMBER IS MARY FREE BED REHABILITATION HOSPITAL.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 7A
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION'S SOLE MEMBER, MARY FREE BED REHABILITATION HOSPITAL, ELECTS THE DIRECTORS OF THE ORGANIZATION.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 7B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: DECISIONS OF THE BOARD ARE SUBJECT TO APPROVAL BY MARY FREE BED REHABILITATION HOSPITAL. IN ADDITION, APPROVAL OF THE MARY FREE BED GUILD, THE HOSPITALS SOLE SHAREHOLDER, SHALL BE REQUIRED FOR: A. TO CHANGE THE PURPOSE OR PHILOSOPHY OF THE CORPORATION; B. TO AMEND THE ARTICLES OF INCORPORATION OR BYLAWS OF THE CORPORATION; C. TO DISSOLVE OR LIQUIDATE THE CORPORATION; D. TO MERGE OR CONSOLIDATE WITH ANOTHER CORPORATION; E. TO ELECT AND REMOVE THE DIRECTORS OF THE CORPORATION. F. TO CREATE OR ACQUIRE A NEW SUBSIDIARY CORPORATION, OR TO SELL, OTHERWISE DISPOSE OF MERGE OR CONSOLIDATE EXISTING SUBSIDIARIES, IF ANY; G. TO PURCHASE, ACQUIRE, SELL, EXCHANGE, GIVE AS SECURITY, MORTGAGE, OR TO DISPOSE OF ANY REAL PROPERTY OWNED OR HELD BY THE CORPORATION; OR H. TO GUARANTEE THE DEBT OF OTHERS BY THE CORPORATION; I. TO ADOPT ANY LONG-RANGE PLAN OF THE CORPORATION; OR J. IN OTHER CASES AS REQUIRED BY LAW.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE FORM 990 IS REVIEWED BY THE CHIEF FINANCIAL OFFICER PRIOR TO FILING.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICIES ARE UPDATED ANNUALLY BY ALL BOARD MEMBERS, OFFICERS AND STAFF. PROCESS IS ADMINSTERED OUT OF THE EXECUTIVE ADMINISTRATION OFFICE. ANY DISCLOSED CONFLICTS OF INTEREST WOULD BE DISCLOSED TO THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS AND ASSURANCES OBTAINED THAT NO ILLEGAL OR SUBSIDIZED ACTIVITIES ARE OCCURRING. THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS ENFORCES THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY AND DETERMINES THE APPROPRIATE COURSE OF ACTION SHOULD A CONFLICT ARISE. IF A CONFLICT OF INTEREST IS EXPOSED, THE INDIVIDUAL WHO IS THE SUBJECT OF THE CONFLICT IS EXCUSED FROM THE MEETING SO THE REST OF THE BOARD MAY DISCUSS THE ISSUE AND TAKE APPROPRIATE ACTION.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: GOVERNING DOCUMENTS AND CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY ARE NOT AVAILABLE FOR PUBLIC INSPECTION. FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE SUMMARIZED IN AN ANNUAL REPORT WHICH IS AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC.
